Join us for a lively panel discussion about how humor and absurdity illuminate our darkest themes, and to celebrate Lambridis's debut novel! A lively, craft-minded panel discussion about how humor and absurdity illuminate our darkest themes. To celebrate the launch of his debut novel, Scott Lambridis joins fellow Bellingham writers David Beaumier, Brittany Micka-Foos, and others from HamLit, in conversation. Together they’ll explore why laughter and lightness belong beside grief and gravity, share brief readings, and invite audience questions. Part craft talk, part celebration of local storytelling, this event promises an evening that’s both thought-provoking and entertaining! St. Ulphia’s Dead is a darkly comic literary novel that follows two disgraced medical researchers investigating mass psychosis and a series of disappearances on a remote island. As the missing begin to reappear, the boundaries between fact and folklore collapse, and the researchers must confront the island’s mysteries, and their own buried truths. Scott Lambridis is a Bellingham-based writer and neurobiology lover whose fiction explores the strange edges of perception, time, and consciousness. His work has appeared in Slice, Fence, and The Café Irreal, and he earned his MFA from San Francisco State University. He once ran an indie press, toured with a progressive rock band, tended an olive farm, read a book from every country of the world, and wrote his debut novel during his daughter’s naps in France. David Beaumier is the youngest recipient of the Village Books Literary Citizenship Award. They have worked in the publishing industry and been a member of the Bellingham writing community for the last twelve years, including as the Assistant Publishing Director at Village Books. They currently help market indie authors and small presses with Chanticleer Book Reviews. When not writing, David teaches Argentine tango locally. Brittany Micka-Foos is the author of the chapbook a litany of words as fragile as window glass (Bottlecap Press, 2024). Her short stories, essays, and poetry have appeared in Ninth Letter, Witness, Literary Mama, Identity Theory, NonBinary Review, CALYX Journal, Briar Cliff Review, and elsewhere. A former victim's rights lawyer, Brittany lives in Bellingham, WA, with her family.
location: Village Books and Paper Dreams, 1200 11th, Bellingham, WA 98225, US
source: Village Books and Paper Dreams (via Eventbrite)

Step into the timeless world of Gluck’s Orpheus and Eurydice with Robert Holliston. A mythic tale of love, loss, and the power of music. Inside Opera is an accessible program for our community to learn more about our productions. New this season, we have moved to this “pay what you can” model. The price point you select includes one General Seating ticket, plus free coffee/tea. $5 - Access Ticket $15 - Suggested Ticket $25 - Supporter Ticket (helps us support offering the access price) If price is a barrier, please email boxoffice@pacificopera.ca and we will book you a complimentary ticket. We're are excited to hear feedback from the community throughout the season on these changes, and we thank you for joining us at Inside Opera.Join us for a free, hour-long event with the always engaging Robert Holliston as he guides us through the dramatic world of Gluck's Orpheus & Eurydice . You don’t need to attend Pacific Opera’s production to enjoy Inside Opera—we welcome everyone, whether you're a seasoned fan or just curious. Seating is limited, so please RSVP through Eventbrite. Each session is insightful, friendly, and often a little funny—perfect for deepening your appreciation or discovering opera for the first time. Experience Gluck’s Orpheus & Eurydice —a timeless tale of love, loss, and the power of music. When Eurydice dies, Orpheus braves the underworld to bring her back, forbidden to look at her until they return. With its luminous arias and the ethereal Dance of the Blessed Spirits , this opera is an unforgettable journey where hope and heartbreak walk hand in hand.

With multiple Beatport-charting tracks and over 10 million streams, his tracks have been featured on Spotify’s top dance music playlists and championed by industry heavyweights like Tiësto, John Summit, Dom Dolla, Marten Hørger, Kaskade, Alok and Anyma. His track 'Set It Off' was featured in Season 3 of HBO’s hit series 'The White Lotus’, and his viral remix of RUFUS DU SOL's Innerbloom has be played out repeatedly on EDM’s biggest stages including Tomorrowland, EDC, Coachella and Ultra Music Festival. event_name: Brazilian Carnaval 2026 | Samba, DJs & High-Energy Party in Vancouver
description: A full-day Brazilian cultural event in Vancouver featuring music, dance, food, and a high-energy evening party. Brazilian Carnaval 2026 is a full-day Brazilian cultural event in Vancouver, bringing together music, dance, food, and community in one immersive indoor venue. Presented by Latincouver and the Brazilian Community Association of BC, this event offers an authentic Brazilian Carnaval experience designed for both Brazilian and non-Brazilian audiences. The program runs from 12:00 PM to 11:30 PM and evolves throughout the day, offering cultural programming in the afternoon and a high-energy Brazilian party in the evening. This is one of the largest Brazilian Carnaval celebrations in Western Canada.
location: Ukrainian Cultural Centre, 3277 Douglas St, Victoria, BC V8Z 3K9, CA

event_name: Casino Country Night with The Rob Curtis Band
description: Enjoy a night of country music by Rob Curtis band, playing hits from the greats: Alan Jackson, Shania Twain, Garth Brooks, and many more! Get ready, Victoria! A full night of live music, dancing, and country favourites is coming to the Platinum Room at The Victoria Casino on Saturday, April 11th. Doors Open – 6:00 PM. Kick off the evening with a FREE line dancing lesson from 6:15–7:00 PM — perfect for beginners and seasoned dancers alike. Grab a drink, hit the floor, and learn some new moves before the bands take over! 7:00–8:00 PM – Stephanie Greaves. Powerhouse performer Stephanie Greaves hits the stage with her band, delivering high-energy dance hits through the ages to get the room warmed up and the party started. 8:30–10:30 PM – The Rob Curtis Band. Headlining the night, The Rob Curtis Band takes the stage with special guest Farrah Simpson for two full hours of country hits and dance floor favourites. Sing along and two-step to classics from: Shania Twain, Johnny Cash, Trisha Yearwood, Alan Jackson, Randy Travis, Gretchen Wilson …and many more! Full bar service, spacious dance floor, live music all night.

Soundtracks to bad decisions and lawn ornaments on your walk of shame. Supported by Ryan Patrick Haint as well as Noah and Maylee. What do 14 Flamingos sound like? (a flamboyance) Soundtracks to bad decisions and lawn ornaments on your walk of shame. A community and a collective of musicians, who work with dancers, artists and circus performers to bring the weird and wonderful to the stage. Combining sounds of art rock, nu-wave. surf rock, burn barrel barber shop quartets, and lost n found 33s in forgotten roadside thrift stores. There are two types of people in this world, 14 Flamingos are the other kind. https://open.spotify.com/album/36cn3ftxznEsyF9GEd93uN Ry Patrick Haint (Apocalypticana) Ry Patrick Haint delivers alt country folk noir. Death, dust, and lonely heartbreak. Noah and Maylee Founding members of the Tower of Dudes go awol. We have a set of old-timey and punk rock songs as played on banjo and accordion. You can sing along or throw cabbages, both reactions are acceptable. Listen: https://open.spotify.com/artist/6Ln7NHoD8yyjPWMhkt0QcD

event_name: Emily Carr String Quartet: Letters from the Rainforest
description: In their season finale, Emily Carr String Quartet gives voice to Carr's wondrous landscapes with music by Shostakovich, Piazzola and Janacek. The Emily Carr String Quartet celebrates their 20th season. Part of the The Emily Carr String Quartet's 20th Season collection.

Aerie Trio returns for more evocative classical music both old and new. Featuring music for flute, cello and piano. This is the eighth concert in the monthly series Musical Melange, taking place the 4th Sunday of the month at 2pm, from September 2025 to May 2026. Series subscriptions are available until Sept 21, 2025.
location: 7180 East Saanich, Saanichton, BC V8M 1Y4, CA

dance_style: fusion, blues, tango, west coast swing, waltz, zouk, lindy, bachata
description: Weekly partner dance gathering rooted in connection, consent, and creative collaboration. We dance fusion and micro-fusion—blending elements of blues, tango, west coast swing, waltz, zouk, lindy, bachata, and other frame-based partner styles. Intro lesson from 7:00-7:30 PM, open dancing from 7:30-9:30 PM. No partner required. Beginners welcome. Gender-free lead/follow; role switching encouraged. Supportive, community-minded atmosphere. Recreational drug- and alcohol-free space.
location: Brigid's Loft, 280 Quincy, Port Townsend, WA 98368, US
